entries.title: gw users list
entries.summary: List all users from Google Workspace
entries.content:
Lists all users synced from your Google Workspace domain. Shows email, name, department, and status.

Options:
- `--limit <n>` - Limit results (default: 100)
- `--filter <query>` - Filter by name or email
- `--suspended` - Show only suspended users
- `--active` - Show only active users

entries.title: gw users get <email>
entries.summary: Get details for a specific Google Workspace user
entries.content: Retrieves detailed information about a single user by their email address. Shows all available profile data including name, email, department, manager, phone, and custom attributes.

entries.title: gw users create
entries.summary: Create a new user in Google Workspace
entries.content:
Creates a new user in Google Workspace. Opens an interactive form to enter user details.

Required fields:
- Primary email
- First name
- Last name
- Password

Optional fields:
- Department
- Job title
- Manager email
- Phone number
- Organizational unit

entries.title: gw users update <email>
entries.summary: Update an existing Google Workspace user
entries.content:
Updates an existing user's profile in Google Workspace. Opens a form pre-filled with current values.

Editable fields:
- First/last name
- Department
- Job title
- Manager
- Phone numbers
- Organizational unit

entries.title: gw users delete <email>
entries.summary: Delete a user from Google Workspace
entries.content:
Permanently deletes a user from Google Workspace. This action cannot be undone.

The user will:
- Lose access immediately
- Have their data deleted after 20 days
- Be removed from all groups

Consider using `gw users suspend` instead for temporary deactivation.

entries.title: gw users suspend <email>
entries.summary: Suspend a Google Workspace user
entries.content:
Suspends a user's account in Google Workspace. The user will:
- Be signed out of all sessions
- Lose access to all Google services
- Keep their data intact
- Remain in groups

Use `gw users restore` to reactivate the account.

entries.title: gw users restore <email>
entries.summary: Restore a suspended Google Workspace user
entries.content:
Restores a previously suspended user account. The user will:
- Regain access to all Google services
- Keep all their data and settings
- Remain in their previous groups

entries.title: gw groups list
entries.summary: List all groups from Google Workspace
entries.content:
Lists all groups synced from your Google Workspace domain. Shows group email, name, member count, and type.

Options:
- `--limit <n>` - Limit results
- `--filter <query>` - Filter by name or email

entries.title: gw groups get <email>
entries.summary: Get details for a specific Google Workspace group
entries.content: Retrieves detailed information about a group including name, email, description, member count, and settings.

entries.title: gw groups create
entries.summary: Create a new group in Google Workspace
entries.content:
Creates a new group in Google Workspace. Opens an interactive form.

Required fields:
- Group email
- Group name

Optional fields:
- Description
- Who can join
- Who can post
- Who can view members

entries.title: gw groups update <email>
entries.summary: Update a Google Workspace group
entries.content: Updates an existing group's settings. Opens a form pre-filled with current values.

entries.title: gw groups delete <email>
entries.summary: Delete a group from Google Workspace
entries.content: Permanently deletes a group from Google Workspace. All members will be removed and the group email will become available again.

entries.title: gw groups members list <groupEmail>
entries.summary: List members of a Google Workspace group
entries.content: Lists all members of a specific group. Shows email, role (OWNER, MANAGER, MEMBER), and type (USER, GROUP).

entries.title: gw groups members add <groupEmail> <userEmail>
entries.summary: Add a member to a Google Workspace group
entries.content:
Adds a user to a group as a member.

Options:
- `--role <role>` - Set role: OWNER, MANAGER, or MEMBER (default: MEMBER)

examples.code: gw groups members add sales@example.com john@example.com
gw groups members add sales@example.com john@example.com --role MANAGER

entries.title: gw groups members remove <groupEmail> <userEmail>
entries.summary: Remove a member from a Google Workspace group
entries.content: Removes a user from a group. The user will lose access to group resources immediately.

examples.code: gw groups members remove sales@example.com john@example.com

entries.title: gw orgunits list
entries.summary: List organizational units from Google Workspace
entries.content: Lists all organizational units (OUs) in your Google Workspace hierarchy. Shows path, name, and description.

entries.title: gw orgunits get <path>
entries.summary: Get details for a specific organizational unit
entries.content: Retrieves detailed information about an organizational unit by its path.

entries.title: gw orgunits create
entries.summary: Create a new organizational unit
entries.content:
Creates a new organizational unit in Google Workspace.

Required fields:
- Name
- Parent path (or root)

entries.title: gw sync status
entries.summary: Check Google Workspace sync status
entries.content:
Shows the current sync status for Google Workspace integration:
- Last sync time
- Next scheduled sync
- Number of users/groups synced
- Any sync errors

entries.title: gw sync run
entries.summary: Manually trigger Google Workspace sync
entries.content:
Triggers an immediate sync with Google Workspace. This will:
- Pull latest users from Google
- Pull latest groups from Google
- Update local cache
- Report any conflicts

entries.title: gw domains list
entries.summary: List domains in Google Workspace
entries.content: Lists all domains configured in your Google Workspace account, including the primary domain and any aliases.

entries.title: gw users add-alias <email> <alias>
entries.summary: Add an email alias to a user
entries.content:
Adds a new email alias to a user. The alias must use one of your verified domains.

Note: Use `gw users get <email>` to see existing aliases.

entries.title: gw users remove-alias <email> <alias>
entries.summary: Remove an email alias from a user
entries.content: Removes an email alias from a user. The alias will stop receiving emails immediately.

entries.title: gw delegates list <email>
entries.summary: List email delegates for a user
entries.content: Lists all users who have delegate access to a mailbox (can read/send on behalf of).

entries.title: gw delegates add <email> <delegateEmail>
entries.summary: Add a delegate to a user's mailbox
entries.content: Grants delegate access to a mailbox. The delegate will be able to read and send emails on behalf of the user.

entries.title: gw delegates remove <email> <delegateEmail>
entries.summary: Remove a delegate from a user's mailbox
entries.content: Revokes delegate access from a mailbox. The delegate will immediately lose access.

entries.title: ms users list
entries.summary: List all users from Microsoft 365
entries.content:
Lists all users synced from your Microsoft 365 / Entra ID tenant. Shows email, display name, department, and status.

Options:
- `--limit <n>` - Limit results
- `--filter <query>` - Filter by name or email

entries.title: ms users get <email>
entries.summary: Get details for a specific Microsoft 365 user
entries.content: Retrieves detailed information about a user from Microsoft 365 / Entra ID.

entries.title: ms groups list
entries.summary: List all groups from Microsoft 365
entries.content: Lists all groups from Microsoft 365 including Microsoft 365 Groups, Security Groups, and Distribution Lists.

entries.title: ms groups get <id>
entries.summary: Get details for a specific Microsoft 365 group
entries.content: Retrieves detailed information about a group from Microsoft 365.

entries.title: ms sync status
entries.summary: Check Microsoft 365 sync status
entries.content: Shows the current sync status for Microsoft 365 integration.

entries.title: ms sync run
entries.summary: Manually trigger Microsoft 365 sync
entries.content: Triggers an immediate sync with Microsoft 365 / Entra ID.

entries.title: api GET <endpoint>
entries.summary: Make a GET request to the Helios API
entries.content:
Makes a GET request to a Helios API endpoint. Useful for debugging and testing.

Common endpoints:
- /users - List local users
- /users/:id - Get user by ID
- /groups - List groups
- /dashboard - Dashboard data
- /organization - Organization info
- /settings - Current settings

entries.title: api POST <endpoint> <json>
entries.summary: Make a POST request to the Helios API
entries.content: Makes a POST request with JSON body to a Helios API endpoint.

entries.title: list 2fa
entries.summary: List 2FA enrollment status across all identity sources
entries.content:
Lists two-factor authentication enrollment status for all users. Shows status from Helios (local), Google Workspace, and Microsoft 365.

Options:
- `--helios` - Show only Helios local 2FA status
- `--google` - Show only Google Workspace 2FA status
- `--m365` - Show only Microsoft 365 2FA status
- `--enrolled` - Show only enrolled users
- `--not-enrolled` - Show only users without 2FA
- `--limit <n>` - Limit results (default: 100)

entries.title: get 2fa <email>
entries.summary: Get 2FA status for a specific user across all sources
entries.content:
Shows the two-factor authentication status for a specific user across all identity sources (Helios, Google Workspace, M365).

Returns:
- Helios local 2FA: Enabled/Disabled
- Google Workspace 2FA: Enrolled/Not Enrolled (and if enforced)
- M365 2FA: Enrolled/Not Enrolled

entries.title: list oauth-apps
entries.summary: List OAuth apps connected to the organization
entries.content:
Lists all third-party OAuth apps that users have granted access to. Shows app name, risk level, and number of users.

Options:
- `--risk <level>` - Filter by risk level (low, medium, high)
- `--limit <n>` - Limit results

entries.title: list tokens <email>
entries.summary: List OAuth tokens for a specific user
entries.content:
Lists all OAuth tokens (third-party app access) granted by a specific user.

Shows:
- App name
- Scopes granted
- Last used date

entries.title: revoke token <email> <clientId>
entries.summary: Revoke an OAuth token for a user
entries.content:
Revokes a specific OAuth token for a user, removing the third-party app's access.

The user will need to re-authorize the app to grant access again.

entries.title: revoke tokens <email> --all
entries.summary: Revoke all OAuth tokens for a user
entries.content:
Revokes ALL OAuth tokens for a specific user, removing all third-party app access.

Use with caution - this will break all connected apps for the user.

entries.title: security <email>
entries.summary: Get complete security overview for a user
entries.content:
Shows comprehensive security information for a specific user:
- 2FA status (Helios, Google, M365)
- Connected OAuth apps
- Recent login activity
- Security events

entries.title: gw forwarding get <email>
entries.summary: Get email forwarding settings for a user
entries.content: Retrieves the current email forwarding configuration for a user. Shows if forwarding is enabled and the destination address.

entries.title: gw forwarding set <email> <forwardTo>
entries.summary: Set email forwarding for a user
entries.content:
Enables email forwarding for a user. All incoming emails will be forwarded to the specified address.

Options:
- `--disposition <action>` - What to do with original: keep, markRead, archive, trash (default: keep)

examples.code: gw forwarding set john@example.com backup@example.com --disposition archive

entries.title: gw forwarding disable <email>
entries.summary: Disable email forwarding for a user
entries.content: Disables email forwarding for a user. Incoming emails will no longer be forwarded.

entries.title: gw vacation get <email>
entries.summary: Get vacation responder settings for a user
entries.content: Retrieves the current vacation/out-of-office responder settings for a user.

entries.title: gw vacation set <email>
entries.summary: Set vacation responder for a user
entries.content:
Enables and configures the vacation/out-of-office responder for a user. Opens an interactive form.

Settings:
- Subject line
- Message body
- Start/end dates (optional)
- Send to contacts only
- Send to domain only

entries.title: gw vacation disable <email>
entries.summary: Disable vacation responder for a user
entries.content: Disables the vacation/out-of-office responder for a user.

entries.title: gw signature get <email>
entries.summary: Get email signature for a user
entries.content: Retrieves the current email signature for a user's Gmail account.

entries.title: gw signature set <email>
entries.summary: Set email signature for a user
entries.content: Sets the email signature for a user's Gmail account. Opens an editor to compose HTML signature.

entries.title: gw signature clear <email>
entries.summary: Clear email signature for a user
entries.content: Removes the email signature from a user's Gmail account.

entries.title: gw sendas list <email>
entries.summary: List send-as addresses for a user
entries.content: Lists all 'send as' addresses configured for a user. These allow sending emails from alternate addresses.

entries.title: gw sendas add <email> <sendAsEmail>
entries.summary: Add a send-as address for a user
entries.content:
Adds a 'send as' address for a user, allowing them to send emails from another address.

Options:
- `--name <name>` - Display name for the send-as address
- `--default` - Make this the default send-as address

entries.title: gw sendas remove <email> <sendAsEmail>
entries.summary: Remove a send-as address from a user
entries.content: Removes a 'send as' address from a user. They will no longer be able to send from that address.

entries.title: gw calendar list <email>
entries.summary: List calendars for a user
entries.content: Lists all calendars accessible by a user, including their primary calendar and any subscribed calendars.

entries.title: gw drive transfer-ownership <fromEmail> <toEmail>
entries.summary: Transfer Drive file ownership between users
entries.content:
Transfers ownership of all Google Drive files from one user to another. Useful during offboarding.

NOTE: This is for Google Drive files only. For Helios's built-in file storage (MinIO), use the Files section in the UI.

WARNING: This operation may take several minutes for large file collections.

entries.title: gw shared-drives list
entries.summary: List all shared drives
entries.content: Lists all Shared Drives (formerly Team Drives) in your Google Workspace organization.

entries.title: gw shared-drives get <driveId>
entries.summary: Get details for a shared drive
entries.content: Retrieves detailed information about a specific Shared Drive including name, member count, and storage usage.

entries.title: gw shared-drives create <name>
entries.summary: Create a new shared drive
entries.content: Creates a new Shared Drive in your Google Workspace organization.

entries.title: gw shared-drives delete <driveId>
entries.summary: Delete a shared drive
entries.content: Deletes a Shared Drive. The drive must be empty before it can be deleted.

entries.title: gw transfer drive <fromEmail> <toEmail>
entries.summary: Transfer Drive data during offboarding
entries.content: Transfers Google Drive files from one user to another as part of the offboarding process.

entries.title: gw transfer calendar <fromEmail> <toEmail>
entries.summary: Transfer calendar during offboarding
entries.content: Transfers calendar events and access from one user to another as part of the offboarding process.

entries.title: gw transfer all <fromEmail> <toEmail>
entries.summary: Transfer all data during offboarding
entries.content: Transfers all user data (Drive, Calendar) from one user to another. Comprehensive offboarding transfer.

entries.title: gw transfer status
entries.summary: Check status of data transfers
entries.content: Shows the status of ongoing or recent data transfer operations.

entries.title: gw transfer list
entries.summary: List recent data transfers
entries.content: Lists all recent data transfer operations with their status and completion percentage.

entries.title: gw users initial-password <email>
entries.summary: Show initial password for a newly created user
entries.content: Reveals the initial password that was generated when a user was created. Passwords are stored temporarily and cleared after viewing or after 24 hours.

entries.title: gw users list-initial-passwords
entries.summary: List all stored initial passwords
entries.content: Lists all initial passwords that are stored for newly created users. Use this to find passwords for recent user creations.

entries.title: gw users clear-initial-password <email>
entries.summary: Clear stored initial password for a user
entries.content: Clears the stored initial password for a user. Use after confirming the user has received their password.

entries.title: create user
entries.summary: Create a new Helios user
entries.content:
Creates a new user in Helios. Opens an interactive form for user details.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also provision user in Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also provision user in Microsoft 365 (coming soon)

Required fields:
- Email
- First name
- Last name

Optional fields:
- Department
- Job title
- Manager
- Phone

entries.title: list users
entries.summary: List all Helios users
entries.content:
Lists all users in the Helios local database.

Options:
- `--limit <n>` - Limit results
- `--filter <query>` - Filter by name or email
- `--role <role>` - Filter by role (admin, manager, user)

entries.title: get user <email>
entries.summary: Get details for a Helios user
entries.content: Retrieves detailed information about a specific Helios user including profile data, roles, and activity.

entries.title: update user <email>
entries.summary: Update a Helios user (optionally sync to platforms)
entries.content:
Updates an existing Helios user's profile. Opens a form pre-filled with current values.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also update user in Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also update user in Microsoft 365

Editable fields:
- First/last name
- Department
- Job title
- Manager
- Phone number

examples.description: Update user and sync to Google Workspace

entries.title: suspend user <email>
entries.summary: Suspend a user (optionally in connected platforms)
entries.content:
Suspends a user account in Helios. User loses access immediately but data is preserved.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also suspend in Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also suspend in Microsoft 365
- `--revoke` - Also revoke all active sessions and OAuth tokens

Use `activate user` to restore access.

examples.description: Suspend in Helios and Google Workspace

entries.title: activate user <email>
entries.summary: Activate/restore a suspended user
entries.content:
Restores a previously suspended user account. User regains access immediately.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also restore in Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also restore in Microsoft 365

examples.description: Activate in Helios and Google Workspace

entries.title: delete user <email>
entries.summary: Delete a user (optionally from connected platforms)
entries.content:
Deletes a user from Helios. Optionally deletes from connected platforms too.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also delete from Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also delete from Microsoft 365
- `--force` - Skip confirmation prompt
- `--transfer-to=<email>` - Transfer data before deletion (when using --gw)

WARNING: Deletion is permanent. Consider using `suspend user` instead.

examples.description: Delete from Helios and Google Workspace

entries.title: export users
entries.summary: Export users to CSV or JSON
entries.content:
Exports all users to a downloadable file.

Options:
- `--format <format>` - Output format: csv or json (default: csv)
- `--fields <fields>` - Comma-separated fields to include

entries.title: export groups
entries.summary: Export groups to CSV or JSON
entries.content:
Exports all groups to a downloadable file.

Options:
- `--format <format>` - Output format: csv or json (default: csv)
- `--include-members` - Include group members in export

entries.title: generate password
entries.summary: Generate a secure memorable password
entries.content:
Generates a secure, memorable password using various styles.

Options:
- `--style <style>` - Password style: random, words, phrase, pin (default: words)
- `--length <n>` - Character length for random style
- `--count <n>` - Number of passwords to generate

entries.title: sync gw
entries.summary: Sync users from Google Workspace
entries.content: Triggers a full sync of users, groups, and organizational units from Google Workspace. Same as 'gw sync all'.

entries.title: list audit-logs
entries.summary: List security audit logs
entries.content:
Lists security audit logs for the organization. Shows who did what, when, and the outcome.

Options:
- `--limit <n>` - Number of logs to show (default: 50)
- `--action <action>` - Filter by action type (e.g., user.create, auth.login)
- `--user <email>` - Filter by actor email

entries.title: list licenses
entries.summary: List organization licenses
entries.content:
Lists all available licenses across Google Workspace and Microsoft 365. Shows license name, total seats, used seats, and available seats.

Options:
- `--provider <provider>` - Filter by provider: google, microsoft, or all (default: all)

entries.title: list logins
entries.summary: List login activity
entries.content:
Lists recent login activity from Google Workspace. Shows timestamp, user, IP address, country, and success/failure status.

Options:
- `--limit <n>` - Number of logins to show (default: 50)
- `--user <email>` - Filter by user email

entries.title: list buildings
entries.summary: List Google Workspace buildings
entries.content: Lists all buildings configured in Google Workspace Admin Console. Buildings are physical locations that contain calendar resources like meeting rooms.

entries.title: list rooms
entries.summary: List calendar resources (rooms and equipment)
entries.content:
Lists all calendar resources like meeting rooms and equipment configured in Google Workspace.

Options:
- `--building <id>` - Filter by building ID
- `--type <type>` - Filter by resource type: room, equipment

examples.description: List rooms in a specific building

entries.title: gw calendar acl <calendarId>
entries.summary: Show calendar access control list
entries.content:
Lists the access control entries for a calendar. Shows who has access and what role they have.

Roles:
- owner - Full control
- writer - Can edit events
- reader - Can view events
- freeBusyReader - Can only see free/busy

examples.description: Show ACL for user's primary calendar
Show ACL for a room calendar

entries.title: help
entries.summary: Show help and available commands
entries.content:
Displays help information. Use without arguments to see all available commands, or with a command name to get detailed help.

Categories:
- Google Workspace (gw)
- Microsoft 365 (ms)
- Security (list 2fa, oauth-apps, tokens)
- API (api)
- System (help, clear, history)

entries.title: clear
entries.summary: Clear the console output
entries.content: Clears all output from the Developer Console screen.

entries.title: history
entries.summary: Show command history
entries.content: Shows recently executed commands. Use arrow keys to navigate through history while typing.

entries.title: bulk delete users
entries.summary: Delete multiple users at once (UI or CLI)
entries.content:
Delete multiple users in bulk.

**Using UI:**
1. Go to the Users page
2. Use checkboxes to select users
3. Click 'Actions' > 'Delete Selected'
4. Choose whether to also delete from GW/M365

**Using CLI:**
Use `delete user` with filter flags.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also delete from Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also delete from Microsoft 365
- `--filter=<query>` - Delete users matching filter
- `--dry-run` - Preview without deleting

examples.description: UI: Select and delete multiple users
examples.code: (Use the Users page UI with checkboxes)

examples.description: CLI: Delete matching users from Helios and GW

entries.title: bulk suspend users
entries.summary: Suspend multiple users at once (UI or CLI)
entries.content:
Suspend multiple users in bulk.

**Using UI:**
1. Go to the Users page
2. Use checkboxes to select users
3. Click 'Actions' > 'Suspend Selected'
4. Choose whether to also suspend in GW/M365

**Using CLI:**
Use `suspend user` with filter flags.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also suspend in Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also suspend in Microsoft 365
- `--filter=<query>` - Suspend users matching filter
- `--revoke` - Also revoke sessions and tokens

examples.description: UI: Select and suspend multiple users
examples.code: (Use the Users page UI with checkboxes)

examples.description: CLI: Suspend matching users in Helios and GW

entries.title: bulk activate users
entries.summary: Activate multiple users at once (UI or CLI)
entries.content:
Activate multiple suspended users in bulk.

**Using UI:**
1. Go to the Users page
2. Filter by status 'Suspended'
3. Use checkboxes to select users
4. Click 'Actions' > 'Activate Selected'

**Using CLI:**
Use `activate user` with filter flags.

Options:
- `--gw` - Also activate in Google Workspace
- `--m365` - Also activate in Microsoft 365
- `--filter=<query>` - Activate users matching filter

examples.description: UI: Select and activate multiple users
examples.code: (Use the Users page UI with checkboxes)

entries.title: filter users
entries.summary: Filter and search users
entries.content:
Filter users using the Users page filtering options:

**Status Filters:**
- All: Show all non-deleted users
- Active: Show only active users
- Suspended: Show only suspended users
- Pending: Show users awaiting activation

**User Type Tabs:**
- Staff: Regular employees
- Guests: External users with temporary access
- Contacts: External contacts without login access

**Platform Filter:**
- All: All platforms
- Google Workspace: Users synced from GW
- Microsoft 365: Users synced from M365
- Local: Helios-only users

**Search:**
Use the search bar to find users by name or email.

examples.code: (Click status pills: All, Active, Suspended, Pending)
